title: Community Layer Value Recognition for Grandparent
description: As a retired grandparent with time and skills to contribute Operating at the community governance layer I want my community care contributions to be recognized and valued So that retirement is experienced as liberation for community service

Feature: Community Layer Value Recognition for Grandparent
  As a retired grandparent with time and skills to contribute
  Operating at the community governance layer
  I want my community care contributions to be recognized and valued
  So that retirement is experienced as liberation for community service

  Background:
    Given the Elohim Protocol is operational
    And the grandparent user "Margaret" is registered in the system
    And Margaret is 68, retired from nursing
    And Margaret volunteers in community beyond family care
    And Margaret has professional skills and life experience to contribute
    And the community governance context is active
    And the community_elohim coordinates community care economy

  Scenario: Volunteer work recognized as valuable care economy contribution
    Given Margaret volunteers 10 hours/week in community
    And she serves at food bank, library, or community health clinic
    When the community_elohim tracks volunteer contributions
    Then it should quantify Margaret's volunteer hours
    And it should calculate economic value of her skilled labor
    And it should accumulate care tokens for community service
    And volunteer work should be recognized as substantial contribution
    And Margaret should see herself as productive community member
    And retirement should be liberation for care work, not obsolescence
    And community should value and appreciate her service

  Scenario: Professional nursing skills contribute to community health
    Given Margaret is a retired nurse with valuable expertise
    And community health initiatives need skilled volunteers
    When Margaret provides health education or clinic support
    Then the community_elohim should recognize her professional skills
    And it should value skilled labor more highly than unskilled
    And her nursing background should be leveraged for community benefit
    And professional retirees should be seen as community resources
    And Margaret's expertise should serve community health
    And skilled volunteering should accumulate significant care tokens

  Scenario: Mentoring younger community members and professionals
    Given Margaret has decades of nursing experience and life wisdom
    And younger professionals and community members can learn from her
    When Margaret mentors or teaches in community
    Then the community_elohim should recognize mentoring as care work
    And it should value intergenerational knowledge transmission
    And it should connect Margaret with mentoring opportunities
    And her wisdom and experience should benefit next generation
    And mentoring should accumulate care tokens
    And community should benefit from elder mentorship

  Scenario: Serving on community boards and governance bodies
    Given Margaret has time, experience, and judgment to contribute
    And community boards need skilled, committed members
    When Margaret serves on nonprofit boards or advisory committees
    Then the community_elohim should recognize governance work
    And it should value her time and expertise in decision-making
    And it should track her board service as care contribution
    And governance participation should accumulate care tokens
    And community should benefit from her wisdom and service
    And retired elders should be valued in community leadership

  Scenario: Building community care networks across generations
    Given Margaret connects with community members of all ages
    And she participates in various community activities
    When the community_elohim tracks social capital building
    Then it should recognize Margaret's role in community connection
    And it should value relationship-building as care work
    And it should show how her connections strengthen community resilience
    And intergenerational community building should be recognized
    And Margaret should help create inclusive, connected community
    And social capital creation should accumulate care tokens

  Scenario: Teaching and sharing skills in community education
    Given Margaret has skills in health, crafts, traditional knowledge
    And community members want to learn these skills
    When Margaret teaches classes or workshops
    Then the community_elohim should recognize teaching as care work
    And it should facilitate skill-sharing opportunities
    And it should connect Margaret with learners
    And community education should be valued and supported
    And Margaret's teaching should accumulate care tokens
    And community should benefit from skill transmission

  Scenario: Coordinating community care during crises or emergencies
    Given Margaret has nursing skills and disaster response experience
    And community needs coordinated care during emergencies
    When community crisis or emergency occurs
    Then the community_elohim should help coordinate response
    And Margaret's skills should be mobilized appropriately
    And her crisis care should be specially recognized and valued
    And community should benefit from retired professionals' expertise
    And emergency care contributions should accumulate significant tokens
    And community resilience should be strengthened by elder participation

  Scenario: Advocating for elder-friendly community policies
    Given Margaret represents retired community members' interests
    And community policies affect elder well-being and participation
    When community considers policies on housing, transportation, or services
    Then Margaret's voice and advocacy should be valued
    And her care contributions should give her standing in decisions
    And elder perspective should inform community planning
    And age-friendly policies should be prioritized
    And community should serve members of all ages
    And Margaret should help shape community for aging population

  Scenario: Connecting community care with family care responsibilities
    Given Margaret provides both family care and community service
    And these responsibilities must be balanced
    When the community_elohim tracks Margaret's total contributions
    Then it should recognize both family and community care
    And it should help Margaret balance multiple care obligations
    And it should ensure community service is sustainable alongside family care
    And total care burden should be visible and manageable
    And Margaret should be able to contribute without burnout
    And community should respect her family care commitments

  Scenario: Care economy capital accumulation for community standing
    Given Margaret makes substantial community contributions
    And accumulated care tokens represent community standing
    When community decisions are made about resources or priorities
    Then Margaret's care contributions should give her voice
    And care economy should inform community governance
    And those who contribute care should have standing in decisions
    And community should operate on care economy principles
    And Margaret's service should be recognized in community leadership
    And care-based governance should be operational

  Scenario: Organizing and coordinating community care initiatives
    Given Margaret has organizational skills and community connections
    And community care initiatives need coordination
    When Margaret helps organize mutual aid, care networks, or community programs
    Then the community_elohim should recognize organizational labor
    And it should value coordination work as essential care
    And it should support Margaret in community organizing
    And organizational leadership should accumulate care tokens
    And community should benefit from her coordination skills
    And care infrastructure should be built and maintained

  Scenario: Building care relationships that support Margaret's own aging
    Given Margaret is building community care networks now
    And she will need community support as she ages
    When the community_elohim tracks care relationship development
    Then it should recognize Margaret is building future care security
    And her current contributions should create community reciprocity
    And community members she helps now will support her later
    And community care networks should enable aging in place
    And Margaret's care work should create long-term community integration
    And care economy should provide retirement security beyond finances
